author: RT
title: ‚ÄòDigital time travel! Best thing on Twitter!‚Äô People praise 'highly addictive' #1917LIVE revolution
text:
‚ÄòDigital time travel! Best thing on Twitter!‚Äô People praise 'highly addictive' #1917LIVE revolution Published time: 18 Mar, 2017 21:39 Get short URL The dramatic Twitter re-enactment of the Russian revolution of 1917 is garnering huge attention online, as it recounts the daily events that changed the course of world history 100 years later. 
RT‚Äôs #1917LIVE Twitter project is retelling the fateful events of 1917 Russia through Twitter with special profiles for Tsar Nicholas II, Vladimir Lenin, Empress Alexandra and many others including everyday Russians who were caught up in the tide of history that swept their country. Thank you for the time travel #1917Live . The war to end all wars was fought 100 years ago and #1917Live brought it to life, a fantastic job. ‚Äî Mr. Sabas (@sabasisaias) February 3, 2017 Whoever is live tweeting the 1917 Russian revolution deserves a medal. True art, so rare on twitter these days. Bravo! https://t.co/grLsWTJZDX ‚Äî Noah Raford (@nraford) March 10, 2017 Tweeting the Russian Revolution #1917LIVE gives a nod to present & Trump tweets by noting that strike leaders are "FIRED!"in all caps "Sad!" https://t.co/gNgIVvfNqw ‚Äî Theresa Fallon (@TheresaAFallon) March 8, 2017 
The ‚Äú as it happened ‚Äù style messages have been winning praise from history enthusiasts all over the world. This is an intriguing project https://t.co/q27JFhmkf0 ‚Äî Adam Taylor (@mradamtaylor) March 7, 2017 Some superb and illuminating content on centenary of Russian Revolution. Follow #1917LIVE https://t.co/nPD7AdxJEt ‚Äî NHSG History (@NHSGhistory) March 11, 2017 
Several people pointed out that lessons for the current day can be gleaned from the historical retelling. The #1917LIVE jam on the Russian revolution serves to remind one how quickly events can overtake what everybody thinks is possible. https://t.co/gUw3zZH7tW ‚Äî Joseph Knowles (@JooseppiKnowles) January 30, 2017 
The project has already recounted several key developments as the course of Russian history changed dramatically in early 1917. It has seen a series of expanding strikes and protests as well as street clashes between demonstrators and soldiers that saw dozens of people killed. The @RT_com #1917LIVE event is becoming the gold standard for combining history and social media ‚Äî var = DCotton üí´ (@andywalpole) March 12, 2017 @RT_1917 can't recommend following this page and its players enough. Truly engaging real time Russian revolution 100 years later. ‚Äî Thilo Young RV (@ThiloYoung) March 9, 2017 
On March 15, Nicholas II was forced to abdicate in favor of his brother, who in turn refused the crown; signaling the end of 300 years of Romanov rule in Russia. ‚Äî Nicholas Romanov (@NicholasII_1917) March 15, 2017 . @RT_1917 is doing a great job on the centenary: so many fascinating sources! https://t.co/tp2q0HtlWM ‚Äî Cotham History Dept (@Cotham_History) March 8, 2017 La Revoluci√≥n Rusa, en tuits. ‚Äî Carlos Franganillo (@cfranganillo) March 13, 2017 
Recent updates show how news of the revolution was greeted in newspapers in Europe and America.
